summary: An email from a Deputy Assistant Attorney General in the DOJ's Office of Legislative Affairs to an unknown recipient regarding a request from the House Oversight Committee about the Jeffrey Epstein indictment. The sender seeks to identify the correct point of contact to address the committee's inquiry.

persons.name: Deputy Assistant Attorney General
persons.role: Deputy Assistant Attorney General, Office of Legislative Affairs, U.S. Department of Justice
persons.context: The sender of the email, who received a call from the House Oversight Committee regarding the Jeffrey Epstein indictment and is seeking the correct point of contact within the DOJ to handle the request.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the indictment that prompted the House Oversight Committee's inquiry to the Department of Justice.

events.title: House Oversight Committee Inquiry
events.description: The House Oversight Committee contacted the Department of Justice regarding the Jeffrey Epstein indictment.

events.title: DOJ Email Regarding Congressional Inquiry
events.description: A Deputy Assistant Attorney General sent an email seeking the correct point of contact to address the House Oversight Committee's request about the Epstein case.

keyFacts: The House Oversight Committee contacted the U.S. Department of Justice on July 8, 2019, regarding the Jeffrey Epstein indictment.
A Deputy Assistant Attorney General from the DOJ's Office of Legislative Affairs was seeking to identify the correct internal team to handle the congressional inquiry.
This document shows congressional oversight interest in the Epstein case shortly after his indictment in July 2019.
